sentences.en: Although the bonding profession has an unsavory reputation, these businesspeople of criminal justice facilitate court operations.
sentences.cn: 尽管保释职业名誉不好, 但是刑事司法中的这些商人有助于法院的工作.

sentences.en: He became appalled at unsavory tricks.
sentences.cn: 如此心狠手辣的手段,使他惊呆了.

sentences.en: I have cleared my piazza of that unsavory flytrap.
sentences.cn: 我除掉了走廊上这只臭不可闻的捕蝇器啦.

sentences.en: I'm ill, and so have to drink these unsavory tea herbs every day.
sentences.cn: 我病了, 每天都要喝这些难喝的水剂.

sentences.en: Lurid crimes. At other times it merely refers to glaring and usually unsavory sensationalism.
sentences.cn: 耸人听闻的罪行. 该词极少用来指怒目而视的并且通常是令人不快的危言耸听.

sentences.en: You'll be in the loving mood but don't let that lead to an unsavory state.
sentences.cn: 沉浸在爱的情绪中,但是不要让它发展为令人讨厌的情况.

words.tran_cn: 难吃的；没有香味的；令人讨厌的

trans.tran_cn: <美>没有味道的，难闻的，（令人）讨厌的，（道德上）名誉不好的
